channel.title: Chris Warrick’s Blog
channel.description: A blog about everything and nothing.

item.title: Inbox (by Google) Review
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
I got a In­box in­vite (hat tip to Daw­id Róż @dav4­dav4) and spent a day with it. The same day, I got the Ma­te­ri­al De­sign up­grade for Gmail. Let’s re­view it.

Read more… (25 paragraphs remaining — a 3 minutes’ read)

item.title: Facebook Knows Too Much.
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
This post is stat­ing the ob­vi­ous. Face­book just scared me with some da­ta points it has about me. Full sto­ry, right af­ter the break.

Read more… (11 paragraphs remaining — a 2 minutes’ read)

item.title: Revamping My Projects Page with Nikola
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
A week ago, I was in­spired to pro­duce a new projects page for my­self. The pre­vi­ous one was a train­wreck with a lot of hack­s. Al­so host­ed on GitHub Pages for some rea­son.

Read more… (6 paragraphs remaining — a 1 minutes’ read)

item.title: Python Apps the Right Way: entry points and scripts
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
There are mul­ti­ple ways to write an app in Python. How­ev­er, not all of them pro­vide your users with the best ex­pe­ri­ence.

One of the prob­lems some peo­ple en­counter is writ­ing launch scripts. The best way to han­dle this is the En­try Points mech­a­nism of Se­tup­tool­s, and a __­main__.py file. It’s quite easy to im­ple­men­t. If you’re in­ter­est­ed, read on to learn more!

Read more… (17 paragraphs remaining — a 1 minutes’ read)

item.title: Speeker — my little Android app
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
Now that I have an us­able phone, I can dwelve in­to An­droid app de­vel­op­men­t. And so I did. I start­ed with an app to test and play with the tex­t-­to-speech ser­vices of An­droid. I named it Speek­er.

Read more… (9 paragraphs remaining — a 1 minutes’ read)

item.title: Series: Chris Warrick’s Android Adventure
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
I re­cent­ly got a brand new smart­phone. I had — pret­ty much — the world’s worst An­droid phone be­fore. The new phone is much more up­-­to-­date and mod­ern. How bad was its pre­de­ces­sor? Well, I’ll be hap­py to tell you!

In a soap opera se­ries. Haven’t done a se­ries since 2010 (and I trashed that one). I al­so haven’t blogged in Pol­ish for quite long (s­ince 2011, to be pre­cise). This is a change in both re­gard­s.

There is cur­rent­ly no sched­ule (and no fi­nal­ized con­tent), but the posts in the series are:

  1. Speek­er — my lit­tle An­droid app
  2. BONUS: In­box (by Google) Re­view
  3. The Four Pieces of An­droid, or why is it so frag­ment­ed
  4. The An­dro-Cheap­o-­Phone
  5. “A <man­u­fac­tur­er> <mod­el>, Sub­si­dized by <car­ri­er>”
  6. Touch­Wiz makes no Sense: why OEM skins are evil
  7. One Sys­tem Fits Al­l: Scal­ing in An­droid

The list of posts might be ex­tend­ed.

item.title: New Year’s Python Meme 2013/2014
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
Via Tarek Zi­adé (o­rig­i­nal meme, none this year…) and Alex Clark. Right af­ter the break.

item.title: Managing Tasks, Chris’ Way
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
Time man­age­ment is hard. The best way to do it is to have a task list, al­so known as a to-­do list. And the best tool? Pen and pa­per. Yes, ana­log pen and ana­log pa­per.

Read more… (4 paragraphs remaining — a 1 minutes’ read)

item.title: Adventures in Windows: Music Player Daemon
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
Re­cent­ly, I had to re­in­stall Win­dows. One of the things I had to set up­ was MPD, the Mu­sic Play­er Dae­mon.

This is a short guide on how to do this.

Read more… (32 paragraphs remaining — a 3 minutes’ read)

item.title: Password Changing 101
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
Yes­ter­day, I fi­nal­ly cre­at­ed a new pass­word for my­self. Now, chang­ing ­pass­words all over the world is what I should do. But it is­n’t easy.

Read more… (7 paragraphs remaining — a 2 minutes’ read)
